PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area.

Let's think step by step.

1. PIDT-C12NT: This is the name of a specific polymer. It is a property name in the sense that it identifies a particular material or substance, but it is not a general property name like "absorption coefficient." Instead, it is a specific identifier for a particular polymer.

2. other two polymers: This is a general reference to two unspecified polymers. It does not identify any specific property names.

3. absorption coefficient: This is a property name that refers to a quantifiable characteristic of a material that describes how much of a particular type of radiation (in this case, visible light) is absorbed by the material per unit of thickness and area.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.
1. absorption coefficient (for PIDT-C12NT and other two polymers)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| absorption coefficient (for PIDT-C12NT) |
| absorption coefficient (for other two polymers) |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: It was also worth noting that PIDT-C12NT showed much higher absorption coefficient than other two polymers in the whole visible area.

Let's think step by step.

1. PIDT-C12NT: This is the name of a specific polymer. In the context of property values, it can be considered as the entity having a higher absorption coefficient than the other two polymers.

2. other two polymers: These are the polymers that have lower absorption coefficients than PIDT-C12NT.

3. whole visible area: This refers to the entire visible spectrum of light. It's not a property value itself, but it sets the context for the comparison of absorption coefficients among the polymers.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. PIDT-C12NT: This polymer has a higher absorption coefficient value.

2. other two polymers: These polymers have lower absorption coefficient values than PIDT-C12NT.

3. whole visible area: This refers to the visible spectrum of light, but it doesn't provide a specific value for the material property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Higher absorption coefficient in the whole visible area for PIDT-C12NT |
| Lower absorption coefficients in the whole visible area for other two polymers |
